Views¶

app.views.dashboard(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Main method to serve the dashboard template with all the variables precalculated. This will generate a form-like interface with responsive buttons and sliders to control various devices within a home.

This view is protected by the @login_required decorator, redirecting unauthenticated users to the signin page.

app.views.dashboard_refresh(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

AJAX-driven method to update the dashboard with the given home pk.

Designed to be called via AJAX, this method returns a container to be loaded inside the dashboard via $.get() containing new data relevant to the selected home via pk.

app.views.home(request)¶

View that serves the home page, index.html.

When a user visits the website at root, this method is called to return index.html.

app.views.register(request)¶

View that serves a registration page, register.html.

When a user visits the register page, a new form is generated and passed to the register.html template. When a user submits this form, a POST request comes in to this method and validates the form, adding the user.

app.views.signin(request)¶

View that serves a signin page, signin.html.

When a user wants to sign in, this method generates a signin form via django.contrib.auth.forms.AuthenticationForm. The form submission comes back to this method to be validated and signs the user in.

Sign in guarantees that the user is entitled to the data they are trying to access within the server. With a signed-in user, validation can be performed by verifying the data belongs to the user (i.e. home.owner == request.user).

app.views.signout(request)¶

This method is called to log a user out.
